title: Bren Student Data Explorer
text:
{{< fa brands r-project >}} shiny dashboard {{< fa brands github >}} source code


What’s the Bren Student Data Explorer?
In an effort to increase transparency surrounding student demographics and post-graduation career placement statistics, the Bren School hired R Shiny Developer Fellow, Halina Do-Linh – she designed and built v1.0 of the public-facing dashboard for exploring these data in summer 2022.



The landing page of the Bren Student Data Explorer, accessible at https://shinyapps.bren.ucsb.edu/student-data-explorer/




My role
I (along with a number of other Bren staff) oversaw the development of Bren Student Data Explorer v1.0 (though to be clear, Halina led the design and technical development of the dashboard – it’s really her product to brag about!). Each year, the dashboard will be updated with new demographic data based on applications and admissions, provided by UCSB’s Graduate Division, and post-grad career placement data from the Bren’s Career Services Team.
In January 2023, I took over as the primary dashboard maintainer. This involved refactoring the code base, processing new data, and updating the dashboard. Some additional refactoring is likely to happen during the next big update in order to further simplify the code base and improve readability for future maintainers.
Check back each year to learn more about our Bren students!

title: John Wilson
text: Hi, my name’s John Wilson, and I am a strategy and analytics executive based in Nashville, TN. Here you’ll find info about my consulting work and as director of insights and analytics with Brookdale Senior Living.

title: Podcast Interview: The Tech Trek by Elevano

Tech Trek Podcast Interview


One of my proudest achievements have been the development of the analytics team at Brookdale. This interview covers some of the aspects of my experience there.

title: Openscapes Website
text:
{{< fa laptop >}} Openscapes website {{< fa brands github >}} source code {{< fa blog >}} blogpost


Project overview
My first freelancing adventure(!) was spent porting the Openscapes website from {blogdown} to Quarto and redesigning aspects of the website’s layout, styling, and overall functionality. I worked closely with Julie Lowndes (founding director of Openscapes) and Stefanie Butland (core Openscapes team member) to bring their vision to life and it was seriously such a fun project. I wrote a blog post about my experience / some of the highlights. Check it out!



Santa Ynez River, Santa Barbara, CA, where Julie and I spent time brainstorming ideas for the Openscapes website
